name: Kabocha Squash
properties: Sweet, dense flesh similar to pumpkin
Rich in vitamin A and C
Perfect vessel for whole grain stuffing
benefits: Kabocha squash is a Japanese winter squash with exceptional nutritional density. Very high in beta-carotene and antioxidants for anti-inflammatory benefits. The natural sweetness and dense texture make it satisfying while maintaining low calorie density. Featured in recipes as a nutrient-dense vessel for kale-cranberry stuffing with whole grains, or in curries for added flavor and nutrition.
amount: 1 large kabocha squash serves 4 people when stuffed

quotes: Rather than starchy, boring bread cubes, the stuffing for this dish is made with my Basic BROL (Barley, Rye, Oats and Lentils), combined with onion, celery, kale and cranberries.
To make a hard winter squash easier to cut, pierce the skin of the squash with the tip of a sharp knife in several places and microwave on High for about 3 minutes.
RED CURRY CHICKPEAS AND KABOCHA SQUASH
